context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: report the missing money to his supervisor
double check the receipts and transactions of the day
immediately inform the owner or the day manager about the missing amount
check the sales records or receipts to see if there were any miscalculations or discrepancies
review the day's transactions, receipts, and surveillance footage if available to identify any discrepancies or mistakes that may have led to the missing money
notify his supervisor or the store owner about the missing money
contact his supervisor or the appropriate individual immediately and report the missing money
check the day's sales receipts and compare them with the amount in the register to see if there has been a mistake in recording or calculation
notify his superiors about the missing amount
thoroughly recount the register and check all the sales receipts or records to verify that a mistake hadn't been made in calculations

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.

stay put once they find a relatively safe and comfortable area

stay where they are

stay in one place rather than wandering further into the wilderness
